intro: Cuitlauzina cariasii, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night. The plant is typically found in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers emit a strong scent to attract nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Cuitlauzina cariasii is also valued for its ornamental beauty and has cultural significance in some indigenous communities.
